title: What a serene, calm, clean temple!
review: Very rarely one comes across such temples. Clean,no one pushing. Pundits not in a rush. People queuing for the 'darshan' calmly!

title: Peaceful, serene place
review: Away from the hustle bustle of town, the temple was very peaceful and full of positive vibes. The book shop had good collection of hindi story books and my daughter enjoyed.

title: a religious place
review: this is a hanuman temple .. very famous among locals .. it is on a hill give nice view of surrounding area

title: Blessings on the hill
review: A very nice temple which also has a cave in it. The place is a must visit in Nainital and has other idols apart from Hanuman ji. Hanuman chalisa is also offered free of cost here.

title: A trip to nainital
review: This temple be is situated 3 kms before nainital.

title: Neat and clean temple
review: This temple have a huge statue of Lord Hanuman. The temple is neat and clean. It has a cave also but that's not so worth to go as it has nothing inside and you need to walk bare foot on road to go into that cave, so if you want you may skip this.

title: Good
review: Very beautiful and clean Temple located 3 km from The Little Bus stand of Nainital very good location and worth to go

title: 22 ft Hanuman idol
review: A big temple near Naukuchiyatal lake. It houses a 22 feet idol of Lord Hanuman. One can visit this temple on the way to Naukuchiyataal lake.

title: Very peaceful temple
review: Unlike other temples, this temple despite being famous remains less crowded and peaceful. Surroundings are clean and the temple is well maintained.

title: Divine destination
review: This is a famous temple of Lord Hanuman Ji.. Highly peaceful and divine place and a must visit for every tourist...

title: Picnic Spot
review: Beautiful picnic spot, with lot of scenic beauty. Place is famous for temple of Lord Hanuman and is a must go place.

title: Very calm place, no crowd!
review: Very nice temple, no rush, very calm. one would love to be at this temple. Very refreshing atmosphere and cold water..

title: A must visit for Hanuman Ji lovers
review: Friends this is one of the must visit temple in Nanital , the temple is built by Neem Karoli Baba himself , this is the first temple Maharaj Ji built in Himalayan region

title: Nice place
review: It is situated a little far from Tallital. Beautiful place and nicely maintained. Must surely visit for quietness.

title: First Temple in Kumoun, associated with the Saint Neemkaroli Baba
review: This Hanuman Mandir just outside of Nanital is the first of 4 associated with the Great Saint of last century, Neem Karoli Baba.

title: Located in a large area
review: It is the best place and the views were also good. Totally entertaining. Located in the large area and looks wonderful.

title: Divine Experience
review: Not really far from Nainitail, situated win a hill top. Car goes all the way up on the top. Established by Neem Karori Babji, a divine place blessed with positive aura around. You get Laddoo in Prasad from the priest which is a delight.

title: Hanuman is not alone
review: Hanuman is sharing this temple with Shiva -- in the next by temple... Note that you have to take shoes off.. if it is cold outside -- and you are at 2000 M above sea level, so it can be cold...it is something to be aware off and think about possible adverse effects....

title: Nice and peaceful temple. Nothing great about it.
review: We visited the lake tour (Bhimtal, Sattal, Naukuchiatal, Hanuman temple) with a drop to Kathgodam to railway station on 21st Mar. We booked a cab for 1700 for this trip. It is cheaper by about 200-300 rs. as tour guides in Nainital were asking about 2000. The drivers no. is 9410515185 (Hafeez Ahmed). very good and cooperative guy.

title: Best location to witness Sunrise & Sunset
review: Visited twice. Excellent views for Sunrise and Sunset. Quiet place, no disturbance in early morning.

title: Nice worship place
review: Well maintained temple

title: Very peaceful place. But beware of monkeys
review: Very peaceful and calm place.  but beware of monkeys.  At times you feel scared if you are not in a group.

title: Beautiful temple of Hanuman
review: One of the beautiful and tall statue of Lord Hanuman we have ever seen at this temple.iI have visited Nainital on 25th and 26th May 2017 along with family.

title: Worship place
review: Hanuman Garhi temple of Lord Hanuman, it is approximately 3.5 km away from the Nainital bus stop towards haldwani. Nice calm & spiritul atmosphere prevail there.

title: beautiful and peaceful place
review: Statue of Lord Hanuman is very tall and beautiful. Very peaceful and calm place. artificial cave of Maa Vaishno devi is also created. Nice place for visit.

title: Jai bajrang bali ki
review: i am a hanuman bhakt and do not miss any hanumanji temple at any place. So how could i miss it. Visiting a temple in the hills is a totally great experience . Do visit if you are there on a tuesday and also anyday if you are a bajrang bali bhakt. Jai bajrang bali ki

title: Very good
review: Very calm and peaceful temple. No rush, you can peacefully offer puja. Very peaceful and calm environment.

title: Peace of mind
review: Not very far from Nainital, this temple is very peaceful and beautiful. Hanumanji is very much popular in this part of India and you will get many temples of him. I felt like time has slowed down over here and impressed the way they managed to develop garden in the middle of temple complex- very beautiful.

title: A nice temple
review: Its a beautiful temple off the road. A temple of Lord Hanuman. The place is cool and quiet. There is a shop outside the temple where you can purchase Prasad and have tea.

title: Peaceful Temple
review: It was a great experience being at the temple. It's very peaceful and you feel connected to your soul.

title: Jay Bajrangbali
review: A lovely serene religious place. The discipline, cleanliness make it a must vist to seek the blessings of Shri Bajrangbali.

title: Hanuman Temple
review: A famous temple dedicated to the mighty lord hanuman,which lies in the outskirts of Nainintal.Hanuman garhi also has a sunrise and sunset point from where you can see one of the most mesmerizing views of the sun dipping in and out.

title: very good temple on Raod
review: Temple is very well managed  Big Statue of Hanuman Jee and the other temple near to this offers a long cave for kids amusement and adventure.

title: Temple of Hanumanji
review: It is near to Nainital on the way to Haldwani. Very peaceful place. Beware of monkies. No camera allowed.

title: Jai Shri Hanuman
review: A quaint temple of Hanuman ji, just outside of Nainital on its own little hill. A must see for devotees of Hanuman ji

title: HUGE!
review: Though not necessarily spiritual in nature, the place is a place worth visiting and you can also check your spiritual awareness by answering a few questions in a questionnaires handed over to you from the Devi temple there.

title: One of the nice temples you will come across in Nainital
review: There is a large Hanuman statue in this temple. Also, inside of this temple is very clean. One drawback is there is a dark tunnel through which you have to pass to reach the inner part of the temple. Overall, it is a good place to visit.

title: And a big lord hanuman to bless your journey
review: a hanuman temple with a big statue of lord hanuman. beautiful and devotional. it is one of the sight seeing point which are provided by the local cab union

title: Hanuman Garhi
review: 3 Kms. from Nainital, this is a group of 3 temples dedicated Lord Hanuman, Lord Siva, & Lord Ram, Lakshman & Sita. A lovely place to visit.

title: Very nice Temple. Must visit place
review: A very beautiful, calm and neatly maintained temple. Either we were fortunate to have less crowd on the day visited or it is usually less crowded I don't know. However, I truly enjoyed the place and its calmness. There are a few temples and all are neatly maintained and have been taken care. Take time at least an hour to spend over here.

title: Are You Lord Hanuman Follower?
review: Hanuman temple created by Lord Neeb Karoli.

title: Hanuman Garhi Temple
review: The place is of much religious importance.situated at a height of 1951 meters,this place was established by Baba Neem Kiroli.From Hanuman Garhi,Watching the Sunset is very soothing.You can walk down from nainital to haniman garhi

title: Jai hanuman
review: This temple is situated 3 km from Nainital. Not suggested to go walking this place

title: Famous temple
review: Hanuman Garhi, a famous Hindu temple of Lord Hanuman, it is approximately 3.5 km away from the Nainital bus stop. The temple is at an altitude of 6,401 feet from the sea level. It was built by Neem Karoli Baba, a famous local saint.

title: One time Visit
review: The temple is very good place for some one looking for spiritual place. There is no views from temple area even though the temple is located at a hilly place.

title: Spiritual place
review: Hanuman Garhi is a spiritual place.. it's not only a temple but a meditation center/ashram as well.
